questions.questionText: How do you prefer to study for a test?

answers.answerText: Answer practice questions aloud
Review images and charts
Think of practical examples

questions.questionText: If someone says the word “lion,” what comes to mind first?

answers.answerText: An ear-piercing roar
The word “lion” spelled out
A fluffy brown mane

questions.questionText: If you went to a concert, what would you remember most?

answers.answerText: How you acted — like if you danced or sang along
How the music sounded
How the venue looked and the faces that you saw

questions.questionText: If you went to a school dance, what would you be most likely to remember the next day?

answers.answerText: The dance moves you did and the food you ate
The music that was played
The faces of the people who were there

questions.questionText: If you won a game, which of these three prizes would you choose?

answers.answerText: A game of some kind (or a football or soccer ball, etc.)
A music CD or mp3 download
A poster for the wall

questions.questionText: If you're ever unsure of how to spell a word, what are you most likely to do?

answers.answerText: Trace the letters in the air with your finger
Spell it out to see if it sounds right
Write it down to see if it looks right

questions.questionText: In lectures, you:

answers.answerText: Listen without taking notes and engage in discussion
Follow along in the textbook and take notes vigorously
Think about how the topic would play out in a real-life situation

questions.questionText: Of these three classes, which is your favorite?

answers.answerText: Music class
Art class
Gym class

questions.questionText: What are you most likely to remember about new people you meet?

answers.answerText: What you talked about with them
Their name but not their face
Their face but not their name

questions.questionText: What do you find most distracting when in class?

answers.answerText: Lights that are too bright or too dim
Noises from the hallway or outside the building (like traffic or someone cutting the grass)
The temperature being too hot or too cold

questions.questionText: What do you find most distracting when you are trying to study?

answers.answerText: People walking past you
Loud noises
An uncomfortable chair

questions.questionText: What do you like to do to relax?

answers.answerText: Listen to music
Exercise (walk, run, play sports, etc.)
Read

questions.questionText: What is the best way for you to remember a friend's phone number?

answers.answerText: Write it down or store it in your phone contact list
Say it out loud over and over and over
Picture the numbers on the phone as you would dial them

questions.questionText: What is your preferred method of receiving feedback on a project?

answers.answerText: Demonstration of how to correct the errors
A one-on-one meeting with an instructor or manager to talk through the errors
Errors highlighted as a visual representation of what to correct

questions.questionText: What kind of book would you like to read for fun?

answers.answerText: A book with lots of pictures in it
A book with lots of words in it
A book with word searches or crossword puzzles

questions.questionText: What's the best way for you to learn about how something works (like a computer or a video game)?

answers.answerText: Figure it out on your own
Read about it or listen to someone explain it
Get someone to show you

questions.questionText: What's the best way for you to study for a test?

answers.answerText: Have someone ask you questions that you can answer out loud
Make up index cards that you can review
Read the book or your notes and review pictures or charts

questions.questionText: What's the best way for you to study for an exam?

answers.answerText: Read the book or your notes and review pictures or charts
Get a friend or family member to ask you questions that you can answer out loud
Make index cards that you can review

questions.questionText: When in a new place, how do you find your way around?

answers.answerText: Look for a map or directory that shows you where everything is
Ask someone for directions
Just start walking around until you find what you're looking for

questions.questionText: When you are angry, what are you most likely to do?

answers.answerText: Yell and scream
Put on your "mad" face
Slam doors

questions.questionText: When you are happy, what are you most likely to do?

answers.answerText: Smile from ear to ear
Act really hyper
Talk up a storm

questions.questionText: When you are not sure how to spell a word, what are you most likely to do?

answers.answerText: Write it down to see if it looks right
Trace the letters in the air (finger spelling)
Spell it out loud to see if it sounds right

questions.questionText: When you give someone directions to your house, what are you most likely to tell them?

answers.answerText: A description of buildings and landmarks they will pass on the way
The names of the roads or streets they will be on
"Follow me—it will be easier if I just show you how to get there."

questions.questionText: When you hear a song on the radio, what are you most likely to do?

answers.answerText: Sing or hum along with the music
Start dancing or tapping your foot
Picture the video that goes along with it

questions.questionText: When you see the word "cat", what do you do?

answers.answerText: Picture a cat in your mind
Think about being with a cat (stroking it or hearing it meow)
Say the word "cat" to yourself

questions.questionText: Which would you rather go to with a group of friends?

answers.answerText: A movie
An amusement park
A concert

questions.questionText: You are moving to a new place. How do you plan where you will put things in your kitchen?

answers.answerText: Find interior design inspiration on Pinterest
Listen to a home organization podcast
Use sticky notes labeling cabinets and drawers as you go

questions.questionText: You are traveling to a new city. How would you plan out your visit?

answers.answerText: Ask a friend for recommendations
Check out the city’s map online to find top attractions
Figure it out when you get there

questions.questionText: You find reading

answers.answerText: Pretty boring; you'd rather be outside
Takes too long; you get fidgety
The best and most relaxing thing ever

questions.questionText: You prefer to

answers.answerText: Listen to things rather than read about them
Handle physical objects and try to understand
Analyse pictures, graphs and charts

questions.questionText: You receive a medical diagnosis. How would you like the doctor to discuss it with you?

answers.answerText: Describe what the condition is
Provide medical brochures about the condition
Show a diagram of how the condition affects the body

questions.questionText: You remember things by

answers.answerText: Watching a demonstration
Experiencing them for yourself (being hands on)
Saying them out loud

questions.questionText: You want to save money for a down payment on a house. You:

answers.answerText: Create a pie chart as you save to visualize your progress
Stuff cash away into envelopes
Meet with a financial advisor to discuss your goals

questions.questionText: You want to try a new hobby. How do you get started?

answers.answerText: Jumping right in and figuring it out as you go
Watch a tutorial video on YouTube
Listen to a podcast featuring an expert on the subject

questions.questionText: You're more likely to remember somebody's

answers.answerText: Name
Hug
Face

questions.questionText: You're out shopping and you are standing in the queue at the checkout. What are you most likely to do while you are waiting?

answers.answerText: Talk to the person next to you in the queue
Fidget, move about or rock / lean on your feet
Look around at other clothes
